message.login_forbidden: This account is inactive or has been suspended
message.password_force_change_desc: You need to change your password
message.password_unauthorized: Check current login credentials and try again
message.password_not_acceptable: Check that new password and confirm password match. You can't re-use your old password
message.name: Name
message.cwe_desc: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) is a taxonomy of software and hardware weakness types
message.project_cloning_in_progress: The project is being created with the cloning options specified
message.analysis_tooltip: The current state of an occurrence of a vulnerability
message.justification_tooltip: The rationale of why the impact analysis state was asserted to be "Not Affected"
message.title: Title
message.subtitle: Subtitle
message.component_identifier_desc: Identifies the component by Package URL (PURL) or CPE. If the version type is 'Exact', the PURL or CPE must contain the version. If a range is specified, version information in the identifier will be ignored.
message.response_tooltip: A response to the vulnerability by the manufacturer, supplier, or project responsible for the affected component or service
message.analysis_details_tooltip: Details (explanation, workaround details, and other impact information)
message.upload_bom_tooltip: Upload BOM, all components will be analyzed for vulnerabilities
message.apply_vex_tooltip: Apply analyses from a Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange (VEX) document to this project.
message.export_vex_tooltip: Export a Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange (VEX) document.
message.export_vdr_tooltip: Export a Vulnerability Disclosure Report (VDR), as defined in NIST SP 800-161.
message.project_reanalyze_tooltip: Runs configured analyzers to detect vulnerabilities in this project's components. Will use any cached results that haven't expired yet
message.project_reanalyze_requested: A Project Vulnerability Analysis has been requested. Project vulnerability data will be updated when the reanalysis task has completed.
message.license_name_desc: The name of the license as provided by the supplier
message.license_id_desc: The SPDX defined ID of the license. The ID may only contain alpha, numeric, and specific symbols: _ - . +
message.coordinates_version_tooltip: You can use the comparison operators >, <, >=, <=, == and != to match specific versions or version ranges
message.age_tooltip: Age in ISO-8601 period format (e.g. P1Y = 1 Year; P2Y3M = 2 Years, 3 Months)
message.inactive_active_children: The project cannot be set to inactive if it has active children
message.component_name_desc: The name of the component as provided by the supplier
message.component_version_desc: The version of the component as provided by the supplier
message.component_group_desc: The suppliers higher-level namespace, group, or vendor identifier
message.component_package_url_desc: A Valid Package URL is required for libraries and frameworks. PURL syntax: pkg:type/namespace/name@version?qualifiers#subpath
message.component_cpe_desc: The CPE v2.2 or v2.3 URI as provided by MITRE or NIST. All assets (applications, operating systems, and hardware) should have a CPE specified
message.component_swid_tagid_desc: The ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 (SWID) tag ID provided by the software vendor
message.component_classifier_desc: Specifies the type of component: Assets (applications, operating systems, and hardware) and non-assets (libraries, frameworks, and files)
message.component_spdx_license_desc: Specifies the SPDX license ID of the component
message.component_license_url_desc: Specifies the URL to the license of the component
message.component_filename_desc: Specifies the observed filename of the component
message.component_hash_desc: Specifies the observed hash value of the component using the preceding algorithm
message.project_name_desc: The name of the project or component as provided by the supplier
message.vulnerability_created_desc: The date the vulnerability record was originally created
message.vulnerability_published_desc: The date the vulnerability record was originally published
message.vulnerability_updated_desc: The date the vulnerability record was last updated
message.vulnerability_source_desc: The originator, aggregator, or publisher of vulnerability intelligence
message.vulnerability_vuln_id_desc: The identifier which uniquely identifies this vulnerability within the same source
message.required_vulnerability_vuln_id: A unique vulnerability identifier is required
message.vulnerability_title_desc: The optional title of the vulnerability
message.vulnerability_subtitle_desc: The optional sub-title of the vulnerability
message.metric_refresh_requested: A refresh has been requested. Metrics will be updated when the refresh task has completed.
message.oidc_availability_check_failed: Failed to determine availability of OpenID Connect
message.oidc_redirect_failed: An error occurred while redirecting to the OpenID Connect identity provider
message.subject: Subject
message.service_name_desc: The name of the service as described by the provider
message.service_version_desc: The version of the service as described by the provider
message.object_identifier_desc: A unique identifier (UUID) that Dependency-Track automatically assigns to every object
message.not_found_in_dependency_graph: Dependency could not be found in dependency graph

admin.bom_formats_desc: Enables support for processing BOMs of various formats. Only BOM formats which are enabled will be processed.
admin.email_trust_cert: Trust the certificate provided by the SMTP server
admin.test_notification_queued: A test notification has been queued
admin.internal_component_desc:
Internal components will be excluded from vulnerability scans and version checks that rely on external systems.
 Note that the regular expressions below must be compliant with Java's regex syntax.
The regex must match the whole string. To match all namespaces with 'example' in it, write '.*example.*'.
admin.namespace_regex_desc: Specifies a regular expression that identifies internal components by namespace. The namespace is often referred to as 'group', 'organization', or 'vendor' in various ecosystems.
admin.name_regex_desc: Specifies a regular expression that identifies internal components by the components name.
admin.internal_identification_error: An error occurred queueing internal component identification. Check server logs for details
admin.analyzer_internal_fuzzy_enable: Enable fuzzy CPE matching. Helps with inconsistent NVD data, highlighting missing risks but also increasing false positives
admin.analyzer_internal_fuzzy_exclude_purl: Enable fuzzy CPE matching on components that have a Package URL (PURL) defined
admin.analyzer_internal_fuzzy_exclude_internal: Enable fuzzy CPE matching on internal components
admin.analyzer_internal_desc: The internal analyzer evaluates components against an internal vulnerability database derived from the National Vulnerability Database, GitHub Advisories (if enabled) and VulnDB (if enabled). This analyzer makes use of the Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) defined in components. Components with a valid CPE will be evaluated with this analyzer.
admin.analyzer_ossindex_desc: OSS Index is a service provided by Sonatype which identifies vulnerabilities in third-party components. Dependency-Track integrates natively with the OSS Index service to provide highly accurate results. Use of this analyzer requires a valid PackageURL for the components being analyzed.
admin.analyzer_vulndb_desc: VulnDB is a commercial service from Risk Based Security which identifies vulnerabilities in third-party components. Dependency-Track integrates natively with the VulnDB service to provide highly accurate results. Use of this analyzer requires a valid CPE for the components being analyzed.
admin.analyzer_snyk_alias_sync_warning: Snyk does not differentiate between related and identical vulnerabilities. Proceed with caution.
admin.analyzer_snyk_api_version_warning: Changing the default version may break the integration!
admin.analyzer_snyk_desc: Snyk's security intelligence database, also known as the Snyk Intel Vulnerability Database, is maintained by a dedicated research team that combines public sources, contributions from the developer community, proprietary research, and machine learning to continuously adapt to the changing and expanding nature of security threats. Dependency-Track integrates natively with Snyk's REST API to provide highly accurate results. Use of this analyzer requires a valid PackageURL for the components being analyzed.
admin.analyzer_snyk_how_to_api_token_help: How do I get an API token?
admin.analyzer_snyk_how_to_org_id_help: How do I find my Organization ID?
admin.analyzer_snyk_how_to_api_version_help: Where do I find available versions?
admin.analyzer_snyk_multiple_tokens_info: Multiple tokens may be provided by separating them with semicolons, e.g.
admin.analyzer_snyk_why_multiple_cvss: Why are there multiple CVSS Scores for the same vulnerability?
admin.vulnsource_alias_sync_enable_tooltip: Alias data can help in identifying identical vulnerabilities across multiple databases. If the source provides this data, synchronize it with Dependency-Track's database.
admin.vulnsource_nvd_desc: The National Vulnerability Database (NVD) is the largest publicly available source of vulnerability intelligence. It is maintained by a group within the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and builds upon the work of MITRE and others. Vulnerabilities in the NVD are called Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE). There are over 100,000 CVEs documented in the NVD spanning from the 1990â€™s to the present.
admin.vulnsource_github_advisories_desc: GitHub Advisories (GHSA) is a database of CVEs and GitHub-originated security advisories affecting the open source world. Dependency-Track integrates with GHSA by mirroring advisories via GitHub's public GraphQL API. The mirror is refreshed daily, or upon restart of the Dependency-Track instance. A personal access token (PAT) is required in order to authenticate with GitHub, but no scopes need to be assigned to it.
admin.vulnsource_osv_advisories_enable: Select ecosystem to enable Google OSV Advisory mirroring
admin.vulnsource_osv_advisories_desc: Google OSV is a distributed vulnerability and triage infrastructure for open source projects aimed at helping both open source maintainers and consumers of open source. It serves as an aggregator of vulnerability databases that have adopted the OpenSSF Vulnerability format.
admin.vulnsource_osv_alias_sync_warning: OSV may report non-identical vulnerabilities as aliases. Proceed with caution.
admin.synchronization_cadence_restart_required: Restarting Dependency-Track is required for cadence changes to take effect
admin.change_password_next_login: User must change password at next login
admin.required_confirmPassword: Password confirmation is required and passwords must match
admin.template_basedir_tooltip: This property is used as base directory for notification templates search
admin.template_override_description: Switching the template override control on and providing a template base directory allow you to override Dependency Track default notification publisher templates.
admin.template_override_file_hierarchy: Any Pebble templates available in the template base directory with the appropriate directory hierarchy and naming scheme (e.g ${base directory}/templates/notification/publisher/email.peb) will override Dependency Track default one.
admin.template_override_security_warning: You must set appropriate rights to the template base directory to prevent untrusted third party from supplying fraudulent Pebble templates that could lead to potential remote code execution.
admin.template_override_restart_needed: Dependency Track restart is required for the modifications to be taken into account.
admin.task_scheduler_description: Dependency Track task scheduler perform various background tasks at a fixed interval. You can modify the fixed interval for each task using the form below. Each interval is expressed in hours. A Dependency Track restart is needed to reschedule the tasks with the updated cadence.
admin.jira_username: Jira user (service account). The user must be provisioned to the appropriate jira instance and permitted to create issues.
admin.bearer_token_auth_enable: Authenticate with a personal access token
admin.reindex_error: Error encountered while submitting reindex request
admin.index_general_description: Dependency Track uses Apache Lucene to enable full-text search on various entities like projects or vulnerabilities.
admin.index_use_cases: The full-text search feature is principally used for the search API (i.e. all the indexes) and internal analyzer fuzzy matching on CPE (i.e. the vulnerable software index).
admin.index_issues_description: The lucene indexes can degrade or drift from Dependency Track database over time. Even though DT does its best to minimize the drift, the administrative features below are provided to check or restore the indexes if need be. It must be used with caution.
admin.index_consistency_check_description: You can enable a periodic background task that will check that all indexes exists, are not corrupted and that their difference with Dependency Track database is under a defined threshold percentage. Any check failure will trigger a rebuild of the corresponding index. A restart is required to take cadence modification into account.
admin.index_rebuild_description: You can selectively trigger an immediate rebuild of some or all indexes. The index rebuild will be perform by an asynchronous tasks. You can check the progress using Dependency Track logs.

condition.unsuccessful_action: Could not perform the requested action

severity.derive_from_cvss_or_owasp_rr: Derive from CVSS or OWASP RR

404.heading: Oops! This is awkward
404.message: The page you're looking for could not be found
